sub_title: Co-Founder/CEO EuroAfri Link l Accessing African & the EU market and intelligence I Facilitate movement of agriproducts across borders: EU-Africa I Collaboration, Cooperation, Partnership and deals brokerage
summary:
I am a passionate and committed Communication and Project Management Specialist trained in Cameroon and the Netherlands (WUR) the world’s leading Agricultural University. I work to improve the livelihoods of underprivileged communities and assist prospective African agribusinesses and students develop skills and linkages with prospective European investors and educational institutions. From my work experiences in the private sector and non-governmental organisations, I have developed better marketing & communication, project management, trade facilitation, and negotiation competencies, and coupled with my know-how about EU regulations on food safety from WUR as well as my practical experience, I can safely bridge the gap between  Africa and Europe in international trade in a sustainable manner.  

Realising that adequate and timely information on opportunities plus technology is a major player in profitable decision-making, but often lacked by African businesses, my passion is to drive this area by making relevant information available to African agribusinesses with a focus on women small-scale farmer cooperatives that have little or no information about external markets & funding, and students. This is intended to be a win-win for all parties.

As a co-founder & CEO of EuroAfri Link (EAL) http://euroafrilink.com/, our core service is to support European food buyers in their African sourcing and African exporters entering international markets like the EU. For I have a strong belief that promoting trade improves the livelihoods of communities in Africa, especially women, and the positioning of African agribusiness that have more women entrepreneurs than men. 

With EAL, I am confident that Africans can benefit from trade (ready market) for their produce, profitable areas for funding agri-projects, and counseling for further studies in European accredited universities. Europeans would benefit from reliable & trustworthy suppliers, fresh quality agri-produce; profit from investment drives, and the increased entrance of high-caliber students into their universities.

profile_positions.description: EuroAfri Link services are threefold; (i) bridging the market gap between African farmers and European consumers, with a keen eye on closing the gender gap in business; (ii) sourcing growth funds for agribusinesses and smallholders; and (iii) providing counseling and bridging of high calibre African students/professionals seeking to study at accredited agri-tech universities and institutions in Europe.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder/CEO

profile_positions.description: Agribusiness Alliance (AAA) is a private sector led, nonprofit, regional platform and network for promoting a globally competitive, sustainable and inclusive African Agribusiness through capacity building, business development, trade and investment facilitation, access to finance, market information and policy advocacy.
profile_positions.title: Member Of The Board Of Advisors

profile_positions.description:
My aim is to attract investments for projects in Africa for their business growth in agriculture, renewable energy, water, and housing projects that have a strong impact potential and safe for investment. These projects will help to close the gender gap and create a win-win collaboration that is free, inclusive, sustainable, and fair.
My tasks:
1.	Assist the EU Tech Chamber to access and understand the appropriate information and service need of African farmers especially women and youth.
2.	Help to strengthen the EU-AU relationship and collaboration through technologies, market linkages, and information/knowledge sharing & transfer.
3.	Assist in business projects and Public-Private Partnerships (PPP). 
4.	Offer support to smallholder farmers especially women for their voices to be heard in an inclusive business transformation. 
5.	Assist the EU Tech with the right tools to make informed decisions about smallholder farmers' empowerment (women and youth).
6.	Contribute to the whitepaper of the African chapter.
7.	Advice and guide other African advocates wishing to join the EU Tech.
8.	Help with advertising events and projects at the chamber. 
9.	Advocate for policies in food system transformation between Europe & Africa, consumers, and producers.
10.	Networking
